title: 1303-A
statement: A. Erasing Zeroestime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a string $$$s$$$. Each character is either0or1.You want all1's in the string to form a contiguous subsegment. For example, if the string is0,1,00111or01111100, then all1's form a contiguous subsegment, and if the string is0101,100001or11111111111101, then this condition is not met.You may erase some (possibly none)0's from the string. What is the minimum number of0's that you have to erase?InputThe first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 100$$$) â€” the number of test cases.Then $$$t$$$ lines follow, each representing a test case. Each line contains one string $$$s$$$ ($$$1 \\le |s| \\le 100$$$); each character of $$$s$$$ is either0or1.OutputPrint $$$t$$$ integers, where the $$$i$$$-th integer is the answer to the $$$i$$$-th testcase (the minimum number of0's that you have to erase from $$$s$$$).ExampleInput3 010011 0 1111000Output2 0 0NoteIn the first test case you have to delete the third and forth symbols from string010011(it turns into0111).

processed.result:
You are given a string consisting of only 0s and 1s.  You want to make all the 1s in the string appear next to each other in a single block. You can remove some 0s from the string to achieve this. What is the fewest 0s you need to remove?

Input:

The first line contains a number  't' representing the number of test cases. 
Each of the next 't' lines contains a string of 0s and 1s.

Output:

Print 't' numbers, one for each test case. Each number represents the minimum number of 0s that need to be removed to make the 1s contiguous.
You are given a string of 0s and 1s.  You want to group all the 1s together into a single continuous section.  You can remove some 0s to achieve this. What is the fewest 0s you need to remove?
